meanings.definition: Reduced in volume, area, length, or scope.
meanings.sent1: The condensed milk was thick and rich.
meanings.sent2: The condensed version of the story was easier to understand.
meanings.sent3: I tried to fit all my clothes into a condensed suitcase, but it burst open!
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was like a condensed storm, intense and overwhelming.
meanings.sent5: The condensed fog made it hard to see the road ahead.

meanings.sent1: The condensed soup was hearty and flavorful.
meanings.sent2: The condensed population in the city made it bustling and lively.
meanings.sent3: The condensed juice was so strong, it puckered my lips!
meanings.sent4: His condensed anger boiled over in a sudden outburst.
meanings.sent5: The condensed perfume filled the room with a sweet aroma.

meanings.definition: To make more concise or compact.
meanings.sent1: She condensed her notes to study for the exam.
meanings.sent2: The author condensed the novel into a short story.
meanings.sent3: I tried to condense my speech, but I ended up rambling.
meanings.sent4: He condensed his thoughts into a single sentence that spoke volumes.
meanings.sent5: The chef condensed the recipe to fit on a small card.
